name: .CHATALL File Extension
summary: Learn about .CHATALL files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: A CHATALL file is a backup file containing settings and chats from ChatALL, an app allowing users to converse concurrently with multiple Large Language Model (LLM) AI bots. It is a Zip-compressed archive that stores multiple .JSON files (ChatALL.json and localforage.json) containing plain text information about settings and chats in the JSON standard. ChatALL users export and import CHATALL files to share or preserve settings and messages.

content: ChatALL is a free, cross-platform utility that various developers maintain as a helpful tool for optimizing conversations with AI bots, including ChatGPT, Copilot, and Character.AI. Additionally, the utility allows you to customize its capabilities and appearance via its settings and enables you to archive chat messages you want to preserve.

For example, in the Windows version of ChatALL, you can choose the preferences by clicking the gear icon in the upper-right corner and then selecting the "Settings" category you want to configure. Furthermore, you can export the settings with the messages by clicking the gear icon, selecting Chats, and then clicking Export Data.

instructions: You can open a CHATALL file with ChatALL (cross-platform). For example, to open a CHATALL file with the Windows version of ChatALL, click the gear icon in the upper-right corner, select Chats, and then click Import Data.

Since CHATALL files are Zip-compressed archives, you can also view the contents of a CHATALL file by unzipping the file with a decompression tool, such as Microsoft File Explorer (bundled with Windows), Corel WinZip (Windows), or Apple Archive Utility (bundled with macOS). You may need to rename the .chatall file extension to .zip for the Zip utility to recognize and decompress it.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
